alert.note: Alert for Otsego (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 07 at 3:07PM EDT until July 07 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central New York, including the following county, Otsego. * WHEN...Until 500 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 306 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to slow moving thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding and overflowing of poor drainage areas in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen with additional rain expected. - Some locations that will experience some flooding include... Cooperstown, Middlefield, Hartwick, Edmeston, Cherry Valley, Bowerstown, Exeter Center, Westville, Burlington, Westford, Toddsville, Index, Oaksville, Glimmerglass State Park and Betty And Wilbur Davis State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
